name: Ascetic
description: Disciplined martial artists who harnesses their inner chi to perform incredible feats and attacks.

specialties.name: Focus
specialties.description: Gathering their Chi, the monk can resist gases, poisons, psionic attacks, and hold their breath one turn per existing `stamina`+ `willpower`.  Monks are immune to the vampiric discipline of `Dominate`.

specialties.name: Iron hand
specialties.description: Deliver a single punch, once per scene, with damage augmented by spending `willpower`, `1` point per damage level.

name: Berserker
description: Fierce warriors who tap into their primal rage to gain incredible strength and combat prowess.

specialties.name: Frenzy
specialties.description: Ignore the first inflicted health levels of damage with no penalty up until `Mauled`, and cannot be stunned.  Barbarians also gain an automatic success on any strength roll once per turn, equal to a permanent dot in Potence.

name: Businessman
description: Astute and savvy individuals focused on commerce and negotiation, skilled in the art of deal-making and resource management.

specialties.name: Persuasion
specialties.description: The Businessman can enthrall his enemies and win them over with her powers of facts and logic.  This is less of a fast power and more of a sustained one.

specialties.name: Wealth
specialties.description: The businessman has access to $$$ and knows how to make more of it. Start with a `Resources` of `2`.

name: Crusader
description: Dedicated sentinels sworn to a code of conduct, armed with divine, academic, and martial skills.

specialties.name: Incorruptible
specialties.description: Heal 1 health level to a target once per turn.  Any First Aid/medicine roles are also automatically granted one success. Starts with a `Faith` of `1`, equivalent to a Discipline.  Crusaders can repel supernatural beings for every success on a Faith role.

specialties.name: Weapon of Choice
specialties.description: Crusaders choose a single weapon they are loyal to and stick with it. Can re-roll any single roll with this weapon once per turn. Can also gain a new specialization at `3`, `4` and `5` dots, granting an additional die whenever a specialized weapon is used.

name: Healer
description: Devout servants of gods or higher powers, with the ability to heal and protect.

specialties.name: Heal
specialties.description: Heal 3 health levels to a target once per turn.  Any First Aid/medicine roles are also automatically granted one success.

specialties.name: True Faith
specialties.description: Starts with a `Faith` of `3`, equivalent to a Discipline.  Clerics can repel supernatural beings for every success on a Faith role.

name: Performer
description: Charismatic performers and spellcasters who use their artistry and magic to inspire and manipulate.

specialties.name: Fast Talk
specialties.description: Performers have an automatic success on any `charisma`, `expression` or `performance` roll, and can immediately command attention. This works even in combat, functionally freezing enemies, including groups, for the first turn. Note that the performer needs to keep doing their act for this to work, they can't drop their guitar and pick up a gun without ruining the effect.

name: Scientist
description: Experts who draw power from their study of esoteric knowledge, with unique and potent abilities and gear.

specialties.name: Delicate Equipment
specialties.description: Choose any Thaumaturgical Paths from the Vampire or Sorcerer book. Apply `3` dots spread however. These should be represented as Tools or scientific equipment that generate the effect. The Lure of Flames might be an experimental flamethrower or backpack-mounted Laser, Lightning might be some weather equipment, and so on. The equipment can be carried gear, but must be present to create the effect.

name: Shaman
description: Nature-focused spiritualists who wield the power of the natural world.

specialties.name: Familiar
specialties.description: A trained animal that can carry out simple commands.

specialties.name: Friend of Animals
specialties.description: Per `Animalism` level `1`

specialties.name: Spirit Sight
specialties.description: Sees the dead, naturalistic spirits, places of power. Can detect supernatural beings, and penetrate spells, illusions and glamour on a `perception` + `occult` roll with a difficulty of `4`.

specialties.name: Read Auras
specialties.description: Learn various qualities of a person from their aura

specialties.name: Astral Projection
specialties.description: Free your mind to travel the world in astral form

specialties.name: Remove Frenzy
specialties.description: Can cool vampires frenzy, werewolves' rage, etc. They become passive for two turns.

name: Soldier
description: Skilled warriors with a wide range of combat abilities and weapon expertise.

specialties.name: Firearms
specialties.description: Can re-roll any single Firearms roll once per turn. Can also specialize in new firearms at `3`, `4` and `5` dots, granting an additional dice whenever a specialized weapon is used.

specialties.name: Hand-to-hand Specialist
specialties.description: Can re-roll any single `Brawl` roll once per turn. Can also gain a new specialization at `3`, `4` and `5` dots, granting an additional die whenever a specialized martial arts style is used.

specialties.name: Melee Specialist
specialties.description: Can re-roll any single `Melee` roll once per turn. Can also gain a new specialization at `3`, `4` and `5`, granting an additional die whenever a specialized melee weapon is used.

name: Tracker
description: Skilled hunters and trackers with a deep connection to the wilderness and survival skills, or the equivalent for the urban jungle.

specialties.name: Camouflage
specialties.description: The Tracker can camouflage into their preferred environment given 1 turn of preparation.  This is not invisibility!  They can be detected on a `Perception` (or `Focus`) roll with a difficulty of `8`. Any attacks made from this position are considered surprise attacks.

specialties.name: Surprise Attack
specialties.description: Surprise attacks do an additional `3` successes of damage. This is a first-strike ability and subsequent attacks are no longer a surprise unless they can be plausibly silent.

name: Tradesman
description: Skilled artisans or laborers who excel in a specific trade or craft, such as blacksmithing, carpentry, or alchemy, often creating items of great value.

specialties.name: Hardiness
specialties.description: The equivalent of `Fortitude` `1`.  All attacks sustained automatically soak `1` success at no cost.

specialties.name: Handy
specialties.description: Free dot in `Repair` and `Crafts`.

name: Under-worlder
description: Sneaky and dexterous individuals skilled in stealth, lock picking, and traps.

specialties.name: Tools of the Trade
specialties.description: The character has an object: (a set of lockpicks, a laser drill, a getaway car, a printing press) -- when used, decreases the difficulty by `2`. This means, for example, a Forger will have a standard difficulty of 4 to attempt any forgery, provided they have their printing press, and a cat burglar can get in anywhere, with his rope and lockpicks.

specialties.name: Professional
specialties.description: Any single `security` roll is done at a `-1` difficulty.

specialties.name: Lay Low
specialties.description: They give off no paper trail, have multiple alternative identities, and their documents will stand up to anything short of a sustained FBI investigation. Granted the background `Arcane` at `2` dots.
